body.p:
Head Qurs. Post at Ooltawah Tenn
May 16" 1864
Governor --

The term of service to the U. States of the 1st Ky vol Inftry expires on the 8th day of June /64 -- being the day on which the last company was Mustered-in -- for three years, completing the organization of the Regmt although many of the companies were Mustered-in during the month of May. In answer to a communication to Dept at Washington, I have received reply, that our Regmt will be mustered-out three years from the date of muster-in of last company, which would be June 8" /64 --

Will you address a communication to the Sectry of War, requesting an order as to the time, and where we will be mustered-out -- This might include also the 2d Ky, with an order through Maj Genl Thomas releiving us from our present Post at Ooltawah, Tenn --

My men have served faithfully for over three years, and I am confident a large majority will very soon re-enlist. -- The sooner they are allowed to go home, the sooner they ^will^ again be in the field

I only desire a definite date to go by -- By
giving this your immediate attention, as our time is short you will much oblige

Your most obt Servt.
D. A. Enyart
Col 1st Ky Regmt
Comdg Post

To/
His Excellency
Gov Bramlette
Frankfort Ky --

1st
Hd qrs Post at Ooltawah Tenn
May 16th 1864
Enyart D A
Col 1s Ky Infty.

To the Governor stating that the last company of his Regt was mustered in to the U S service on the 8th day June 1861 for 3 years. Desires you to address a communication to the Secy of War, requesting an order as to where and when they will be mustered out with an order in Genl Thomas to relieve them. Thinks a large majority of them will reenlist after their time is out. This request might be made to Embrace the 2d Ky also.

Recd. (A G O) May 30 1864.
Recd A. G. O 24 May 1864

Head Quarters Ky. vols.
Adjutant General's office.
Frankfort -- May 25th 1864

Respectfully forwarded by His Excellency -- Gov. Bramlette, to the Adjutant General of the Army with the request that he will endorse herein -- an answer to the inquiries contained in this communication -- and return the same to this office. The reply will be sent Col. Enyart, and also, other commanders making similar requests.

John Boyle
Adjt Gen. of Ky

War Dept A. G. O.
June 2" 1864
Respectfully returned to His Excellency the Governer of Kentucky, with copy of circular from this office of date May 2nd 1864, showing the system upon which Regiments are Mustered out of service.

Thomas M Vincent
Assistant Adjt General.

K. 387, (V. S.) 1864
Frankfort, May 25/64
Ky. -- State of --
Jno. Boyle,
Adj. Gen'l.
Forwards and requests reply to communication of D. A. Enyart, Col. 1st Ky. Vols. relating to the muster-out of a Company of his Regt. mustered-in June 8, 1861.

Address -- Col. Enyart.
Recd. (A G O) May 30, 1864.
